credentials_craft_token.title: CredentialsCraft Token
credentials_craft_token.description: Long-term CredentialsCraft Access Token (NOT Google token).

client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: The Client ID of your Google Analytics developer application.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: The Client Secret of your Google Analytics developer application.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: The token for obtaining a new access token.

access_token.title: Access Token (Optional)
access_token.description: Access Token for making authenticated requests.

credentials_json.title: Service Account JSON Key
credentials_json.description: The JSON key of the service account to use for authorization

start_date.title: Date From
start_date.description: The date in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Any data before this date will not be replicated.

end_date.title: Date To
end_date.description: The date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

last_days.title: Load last n days
last_days.description: If not set â€“ last 5 days will be used

client_name.title: Client Name Constant
client_name.description: Constant that will be used in record __clientName property

product_name.title: Product Name Constant
product_name.description: Constant that will be used in record __productName property

custom_json.title: Custom JSON
custom_json.description: Custom JSON for additional record properties. Must be string of JSON object with first-level properties

view_id.title: View ID
view_id.description: The ID for the Google Analytics View you want to fetch data from. This can be found from the Google Analytics Account Explorer.

custom_reports.title: Custom Reports (Optional)
custom_reports.description: A JSON array describing the custom reports you want to sync from Google Analytics. See the docs for more information about the exact format you can use to fill out this field.

window_in_days.title: Data request time increment in days (Optional)
window_in_days.description: The time increment used by the connector when requesting data from the Google Analytics API. More information is available in the the docs. The bigger this value is, the faster the sync will be, but the more likely that sampling will be applied to your data, potentially causing inaccuracies in the returned results. We recommend setting this to 1 unless you have a hard requirement to make the sync faster at the expense of accuracy. The minimum allowed value for this field is 1, and the maximum is 364.
